meanings.sent1: The balloon herniated when too much air was blown into it.
meanings.sent2: The ground herniated slightly under the weight of the heavy statue.
meanings.sent3: The overstuffed suitcase herniated open, spilling clothes everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The dam held back the water until it herniated through a crack in the wall.
meanings.sent5: The chef watched in horror as the cake herniated in the oven, causing a mess.

meanings.definition: (adjective) having a protrusion or bulge, especially in reference to a disc in the spine
meanings.sent1: The herniated tire on the car needed immediate replacement.
meanings.sent2: The herniated disc in his back caused him a lot of pain.
meanings.sent3: The herniated pillow made it uncomfortable to sleep on.
meanings.sent4: The herniated button on the shirt made it difficult to fasten.
meanings.sent5: The herniated rock in the path tripped up many hikers.
